title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: Aswe approached the Manse of Loch Lee, the glenwidened, and the old Castle of Invermark cameout extremely well ; and, surrounded by woods andcorn-fields, in which the people were " shearing,"looked most picturesque.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: This place is calledInvermark, and is four and a half miles fromCorrie Vruach.
